io.netty.buffer

Interface ByteBufIndexFinder


  • public interface ByteBufIndexFinder
    Locates an index of data in a ByteBuf.

    This interface enables the sequential search for the data which meets more complex and dynamic condition than just a simple value matching. Please refer to ByteBuf.indexOf(int, int, ByteBufIndexFinder) and ByteBuf.bytesBefore(int, int, ByteBufIndexFinder) for more explanation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ByteBufIndexFinder CR
      Index finder which locates a CR ('\r') byte.
      static ByteBufIndexFinder CRLF
      Index finder which locates a CR ('\r') or LF ('\n').
      static ByteBufIndexFinder LF
      Index finder which locates a LF ('\n') byte.
      static ByteBufIndexFinder LINEAR_WHITESPACE
      Index finder which locates a linear whitespace (' ' and '\t').
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NOT_CR
      Index finder which locates a non-CR ('\r') byte.
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NOT_CRLF
      Index finder which locates a byte which is neither a CR ('\r') nor a LF ('\n').
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NOT_LF
      Index finder which locates a non-LF ('\n') byte.
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NOT_LINEAR_WHITESPACE
      Index finder which locates a byte which is not a linear whitespace (neither ' ' nor '\t').
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NOT_NUL
      Index finder which locates a non-NUL (0x00) byte.
      static ByteBufIndexFinder NUL
      Index finder which locates a NUL (0x00) byte.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean find(ByteBuf buffer, int guessedIndex)
      Returns true if and only if the data is found at the specified guessedIndex of the specified buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        boolean find(ByteBuf buffer,
           int guessedIndex)
        Returns true if and only if the data is found at the specified guessedIndex of the specified buffer.

        The implementation should not perform an operation which raises an exception such as IndexOutOfBoundsException nor perform an operation which modifies the content of the buffer.
